thread.title: No.10 Refuses To Answer Questions About Theresa May's Role In Guantanamo Compensation Case
thread.title_full: No.10 Refuses To Answer Questions About Theresa May's Role In Guantanamo Compensation Case

author: Paul Waugh
title: No.10 Refuses To Answer Questions About Theresa May's Role In Guantanamo Compensation Case
text:
No.10 Refuses To Answer Questions About Theresa May's Role In Guantanamo Compensation Case 'An intelligence issue' 22/02/2017 15:50 | Updated 12 minutes ago Paul Waugh Executive Editor, Politics, HuffingtonPost UK TOBY MELVILLE via Getty Images Theresa May’s spokesman would not comment on claims by Tony Blair that the last Tory-Liberal Democrat government oversaw a £1m compensation deal for a former Guantanamo Bay inmate 
Downing Street has flatly refused to discuss Theresa May’s role in a £1m compensation deal for a former Guantanamo Bay inmate who went on to become an IS suicide bomber. 
Despite repeated questioning, the PM’s spokesman said only that it was “an intelligence matter” and would not comment on claims by Tony Blair that the last Tory-Liberal Democrat government oversaw the deal. Here is how the prime minister’s spokesman responded when quizzed on the matter: Related...
